glsa.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in sysstat
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities in the way sysstat handles symlinks may allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code or overwrite arbitrary files

background.p: sysstat is a package containing a number of performance monitoring utilities for Linux, including sar, mpstat, iostat and sa tools

description.p: There are two vulnerabilities in the way sysstat handles symlinks:

ol.li: The isag utility, which displays sysstat data in a graphical format, creates a temporary file in an insecure manner.
Two scripts in the sysstat package, post and trigger, create temporary files in an insecure manner.

impact.p: Both vulnerabilities may allow an attacker to overwrite arbitrary files under the permissions of the user executing any of the affected utilities.

workaround.p: A workaround is not currently known for this issue. All users are advised to upgrade to the latest version of the affected package.

resolution.p: Systat users should upgrade to version 4.2 or later:
